nodes.bodyText: Check if you can use buildApplication in BuildApplication.java to build your app?

I actually looked at this method when coding. My understanding is buildApplication is just zip the app. What we need here is 1) create a .gar file, 2) create WDT archive, seems not meet the requirement.

Not true. buildApplication copies your app dir (zips it) into a pod with weblogic install, builds the app and then copies it out of the pod. Please check again. Both Sankar and I use this to build apps.
my mistake. I am going to try to use buildApplication in BuildApplication.java

currently, what the test is doing is that app and script are copied to, build and run in MS pods directly
using buildApplication method, the test needs to copy app and script to a temp pod and build the app there, and then m=need to copy app and script to MS pods and run it there in MS pods

To keep it simple, decided to do what the test is doing now. So no changes here
I still think we should reuse existing code, but since there seem to be some issues right now using it, I guess it is fine.
not sure what this comment means.
Check service check before pod ready check.
not needed - same comment as earlier
move this before pod ready check.
I think you can use buildApplication() in BuildApplication.java for this.
This method is used to build archive for coherence-proxy-server. After discussing with Bhavani, we both agree to keep it as it is
Can you check if the existing method to build the archive be used?
I did. existing method create a .ear/war fiule and then zip. what we need for this test is .gar and then zip
This method is used to build archive for coherence-proxy-server. After discussing with Bhavani, we both agree to keep it as it is

nodes.bodyText: Do you need a new line in each log message.  Same comment on previous log statements.
The Namespace is already created by infra, here we are assigning a  namespace.  So better we should comment " Assigning a unique namespace for Operator  ( Domain ) "
Extra "---"  Change the  statement logger.info("Coherence Server restated in rolling fashion")

changed to:
logger.info("SUCCESS --- Coherence Server restarted in rolling fashion");

+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+
+<!-- ================================================================================= -->
+<!-- Copyright (c) 2020, Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates. -->
+<!-- Licensed under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 as shown at https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl. -->
+<!-- ================================================================================= -->
+
+<!-- ====================================================================== -->
+<!-- Ant build file (http://ant.apache.org/) for Ant 1.6.2 or above.        -->
+<!-- ====================================================================== -->
+
+<project name="proxy-client" default="package" basedir=".">
+
+
+  <!-- ====================================================================== -->
+  <!-- Build environment properties                                           -->
+  <!-- ====================================================================== -->
+
+  <property file="maven-build.properties"/>
+  <property environment="env"/>
+  <property name="maven.build.finalName" value="proxy-client-1.0"/>
+  <property name="maven.build.dir" value="target"/>
+  <property name="maven.build.outputDir" value="${maven.build.dir}/classes"/>
+  <property name="maven.build.srcDir.0" value="src/main/java"/>
+  <property name="maven.build.resourceDir.0" value="src/main/resources"/>
+  <property name="maven.reporting.outputDirectory" value="${maven.build.dir}/site"/>
+
+  <property name="maven.settings.offline" value="false"/>
+  <property name="maven.settings.interactiveMode" value="true"/>
+
+  <!-- ====================================================================== -->
+  <!-- Defining classpaths                                                    -->
+  <!-- ====================================================================== -->
+
+  <path id="build.classpath">
+    <pathelement location="${env.ORACLE_HOME}/coherence/lib/coherence.jar"/>
+  </path>
+
+
+  <!-- ====================================================================== -->
+  <!-- Cleaning up target                                                     -->
+  <!-- ====================================================================== -->
+
+  <target name="clean" description="Clean the output directory">
+    <delete dir="${maven.build.dir}"/>
+  </target>
+
+  <!-- ====================================================================== -->
+  <!-- Compilation target                                                     -->
+  <!-- ====================================================================== -->
+
+  <target name="compile" depends="get-deps" description="Compile the code">
+    <mkdir dir="${maven.build.outputDir}"/>
+    <javac destdir="${maven.build.outputDir}"
+      nowarn="false"
+      debug="true"
+      optimize="false"
+      deprecation="true"
+      target="1.8"
+      verbose="false"
+      fork="false"
+      source="1.8">
+      <src>
+        <pathelement location="${maven.build.srcDir.0}"/>
+      </src>
+      <classpath refid="build.classpath"/>
+    </javac>
+    <copy todir="${maven.build.outputDir}">
+      <fileset dir="${maven.build.resourceDir.0}"/>
+    </copy>
+  </target>
+
+
+  <!-- ====================================================================== -->
+  <!-- Package target                                                         -->
+  <!-- ====================================================================== -->
+
+  <target name="package" depends="compile" description="Package the application">
+    <jar jarfile="${maven.build.dir}/${maven.build.finalName}.jar"
+      compress="true"
+      index="false"
+      basedir="${maven.build.outputDir}"
+      excludes="**/package.html"/>
+  </target>
+
+  <!-- ====================================================================== -->

nodes.bodyText: Remove the comment  regarding 'MBean unit test ..."
The test uses DomainHomeInImage Model with WDT, but the description say  "create and verify WebLogic domain image using model in image with model files"
Remove extra "---" No need to add the word "SUCCESS" in log message
change the variable name to domImage to reflect the DomainHomeInImage configuration
